Event.name: Hiring
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Employer</fen> hires an <fen>Employee</fen>, promising the <fen>Employee</fen> a certain <fen>Compensation</fen> in exchange for the performance of a job. The job may be described either in terms of a <fen>Task</fen> or a <fen>Position</fen>. In some cases, the <fen>Employee</fen> FE will also indicate the <fen>Position</fen> (see fourth example below).
<ex><fex name="Empee">John</fex> was <t>hired</t> <fex name="Task">to clean up the file system</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Emper">IBM</fex> <t>hired</t> <fex name="Empee">Gates</fex> <fex name="Posit">as chief janitor</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Empee">I</fex> was <t>retained</t> <fex name="Compense">at $500 an hour</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Emper">The A's</fex> <t>signed</t> <fex name="Empee">a new third baseman</fex> <fex name="Compense">for $30M</fex>.</ex> The same sentence (above) should also have the FE <fen>Position</fen> on the second layer: <ex>The A's <t>signed</t> <fex name="Posit">a new third baseman</fex> for $30M.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Employee
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person whom the <fen>Employer</fen> takes on as an <fen>Employee</fen>, obligating them to perform some <fen>Task</fen> in order to receive <fen>Compensation</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Employee">I</fex> was just <t>hired</t> yesterday!</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Employer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person (or institution) that takes on an <fen>Employee</fen>, giving them <fen>Compensation</fen> in return for the performance of an assigned <fen>Task</fen>.
<ex>Last month, <fex name="Emper">IBM</fex> <t>hired</t> Mike Zisman to head up its storage software group.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Compensation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Compensation</fen> is the payment that the <fen>Employee</fen> is set to receive for performing an assigned <fen>Task</fen>.
<ex>They fired our management, <t>hired</t> him <fex name="Compense">for 20% more</fex> and gave him a free office to set up his own company.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which an <fen>Employer</fen> hires an <fen>Employee</fen>.
<ex>The three young men were given medals and <fex name="Manner">hastily</fex> <t>commissioned</t></ex>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the place where the <fen>Employer</fen> hires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
<ex>Actually, he <t>hired</t> me <fex name="Place">in a bordello</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an <fen>Employer</fen> hires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
<ex>Guess who just got <t>hired</t> <fex name="Time">today</fex>!</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an <fen>Employer</fen> hires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
<ex>John <t>hired</t> her <fex name="Purp">to make his wife jealous</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Task
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The action that the <fen>Employee</fen> is taken on by the <fen>Employer</fen> to do.
<ex>I was <t>hired</t> <fex name="Task">just to empty the trash cans</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Position
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The label given to a particular type of employment.
<ex>Look, I wasn't <t>hired</t> <fex name="Posit">as your waitress</fex>!</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Field
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Field</fen> that the <fen>Employee</fen> is going to work in for their <fen>Employer</fen>.
<ex>It's not easy to get <t>hired</t> <fex name="Field">in academia</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An entity that the <fen>Employer</fen> uses to hire the <fen>Employee</fen>.
<ex>The congressman <t>hired</t> him <fex name="Instrument">with personal funds</fex> as an aide. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action by the <fen>Employer</fen> whereby the hire is brought about.
<ex>The manager <t>hired</t> me <fex name="Means">with a handshake</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Contract_basis
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Contract_basis</fen> is the condition of employment with respect to permanency, hours per time period or payment arrangements.
<ex>She couldn't figure it out but suggested that I'd be good for the job, so they <t>hired</t> me <fex name="cb">part time</fex> at first.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the hiring event began to be repeated to when it stopped. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: subcontract.v

lexUnit.name: sign on.v
